references.paper_title: Granite-function calling model: Introducing function calling abilities via multi-task learning of granular tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel function-calling model, Granite, which is compared against in the experimental section of the CoALM paper, demonstrating the state-of-the-art in this area.

references.paper_title: InstructTODS: Large language models for end-to-end task-oriented dialogue systems
references.reason: This paper explores the use of LLMs for end-to-end task-oriented dialogue systems, a relevant topic given that CoALM also aims to create a unified conversational agent.

references.paper_title: API-bank: A comprehensive benchmark for tool-augmented LLMs
references.reason: This paper introduces API-Bank, a benchmark dataset used in the CoALM paper's evaluation, providing a crucial resource for comparing different conversational agent models.

references.paper_title: Toolformer: Language models can teach themselves to use tools
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant given its focus on Language Agents (LAs) which is one of the core components of CoALM.

references.paper_title: ReAct: Synergizing reasoning and acting in language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the ReAct framework, which is a central part of CoALM's design and is used extensively in creating its benchmark datasets.
